meanings.definition: A structure built perpendicular to the shore to prevent erosion.
meanings.sent1: The groynes at the beach help stop the sand from washing away.
meanings.sent2: The city installed groynes to protect the coastline from erosion.
meanings.sent3: The groynes were like the guardians of the shore, standing tall against the waves.
meanings.sent4: The groynes stood like soldiers, holding back the relentless sea.
meanings.sent5: The groynes stood stoically, their duty to protect the shore unwavering.

meanings.definition: A wooden or concrete barrier used to trap sediment along a coastline.
meanings.sent1: The groynes trapped the sand, creating a calm bay.
meanings.sent2: The beach was lined with groynes to prevent sand from drifting away.
meanings.sent3: The groynes played a game of catch with the sand, never letting it escape.
meanings.sent4: The groynes acted as a net, capturing the sediment as it flowed.
meanings.sent5: The groynes embraced the sand, holding it close to the shore.
